title.narrative: GUINEA COVID-19 PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE PROJECT

description.narrative: To prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness in Guinea.

condition.narrative: No later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget for Project implementation, settingforth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposed conferences and Training, under theProject for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of funds therefor; (iii) procurement andenvironmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable; and (iv) responsibility for the execution of said Projectactivities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to track progress of each activity.
Schedule 2. Section I. A.2. The Recipient shall ensure that the PCU updates the accounting software no later than one (1) monthafter the Effective Date

Schedule 2. Section I. B.1.(a) The Recipient shall by no later than one (1) month, after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt aProject implementation manual (“Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring and evaluation, financialmanagement, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, agrievance redress mechanism, personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHO and national guidelines,roles and responsibilities for Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for theeffective implementation of the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2. Section I. B.2.(a) no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare a draft work plan and budget forProject implementation, setting forth, inter alia: (i) a detailed description of the planned activities, including any proposedconferences and Training, under the Project for the period covered by the plan; (ii) the sources and proposed use of fundstherefor; (iii) procurement and environmental and social safeguards arrangements therefor, as applicable; and (iv) responsibilityfor the execution of said Project activities, budgets, start and completion dates, outputs and monitoring indicators to trackprogress of each activity.

The Recipient shall by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, update the Project implementation manual for theOriginal Project (as so updated, “Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring and evaluation, financialmanagement, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, agrievance redress mechanism, eligibility criteria, personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHOand national guidelines, roles and responsibilities for Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shallbe required for the effective implementation of the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

The Recipient shall by no later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, update the Project implementation manual for theOriginal Project (as so updated, “Project Implementation Manual”) containing detailed guidelines and procedures for theimplementation of the Project, including with respect to: administration and coordination, monitoring and evaluation, financialmanagement, procurement and accounting procedures, environmental and social safeguards, corruption and fraud mitigation measures, agrievance redress mechanism, eligibility criteria, personal data collection and processing in accordance with the applicable WHOand national guidelines, roles and responsibilities for Project implementation, and such other arrangements and procedures as shallbe required for the effective implementation of the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.
